did.unittitle: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences records

bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of files from the office of the Dean of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Administrative records include policy manuals, admissions statistics, evaluations, and job descriptions. Correspondence files date from 1972 to 1997; correspondence relates to the curriculum assessment, Campus Ministry, department and faculty matters, institutes and societies, and the Honors Program. Minutes are present for the Ad Hoc Committee on Core Curriculum (1986-1990), Dean and Chairmen's meetings (1973-1997), and for meetings of various College departments and committees. Printed materials in the collection include a grant manual, brochures, and descriptions of the Honors Program. The collection also includes reports related to programs and departments, curriculum and academic status, and various task forces and committees.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
